title: 2025 Honda SP 160 launched at Rs. 1.22 lakh - BikeWale
CATL Unveils Chassis It Says Can Withstand Fires From Crashes | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
CATL Unveils Chassis It Says Can Withstand Fires From Crashes

Date: Unknown | Source: Bloomberg

Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. unveiled a new car chassis with an integrated battery designed to withstand fires or explosions from high-impact collisions.

  • The chassis can decouple from the car body and absorb energy from collisions up to 120 kms/hour.
  • Chinese EV brand Avatr is collaborating with CATL to develop cars based on this chassis.
  • The development aims to address consumer fears regarding EV battery fires.
  • CATL is expanding its offerings beyond batteries amidst slowing demand for pure-battery vehicles.
  • The company plans to roll out 1,000 battery swapping stations by the end of 2025.
The risk of EV battery fires, which are difficult to extinguish, is a detraction for some would-be buyers.

CATL's innovations aim to enhance EV adoption and reduce costs by addressing safety concerns.
newTitle: CATL Unveils Chassis It Says Can Withstand Fires From Crashes

title: "Makes You Question...": Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta On Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani's Untimely Death - NDTV
summary:
“Makes You Question...”: Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta On Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani's Untimely Death

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 Source: Twitter

Radhika Gupta, CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, expressed her sorrow over the sudden death of Rohan Mirchandani, co-founder of Epigamia, who passed away at the age of 41 from a cardiac arrest. This tragic event prompted a discussion about the alarming trend of young professionals facing stress-related health issues.

"It is heartbreaking to see stories of so many folks I know losing their lives in their 40s and 50s to heart attacks and stress-related ailments. It makes you question a lot of things." — Radhika Gupta

Key Points:

  • Rohan Mirchandani died from a cardiac arrest at 41, shocking the business community.
  • Radhika Gupta highlighted the rising incidents of premature deaths from heart conditions among young professionals.
  • Gupta emphasized the importance of managing stress and practicing gratitude.
  • Other industry leaders also paid tribute, recognizing Mirchandani's contributions to the startup ecosystem.

Gupta’s reflection and call for awareness regarding heart health and stress management resonate strongly in today's fast-paced work environments.
newTitle: Radhika Gupta Reflects on Rohan Mirchandani's Death: A Wake-Up Call on Heart Health

title: Vedanta shares drop 3%, stock trades ex-dividend today; check key details - Upstox
summary:
Vedanta Shares Drop 3% as Stock Trades Ex-Dividend

Date: December 24, 2024
Source: Upstox

Shares of Vedanta Ltd experienced a decline of 3.04% to ₹458.70 as they turned ex-dividend today.

The company announced its fourth interim dividend of ₹8.5 per share, totaling approximately ₹3,324 crore for FY 2024-25.

  • On December 16, the fourth interim dividend was approved.
  • Total payout for FY 2024-25 now stands at ₹16,798 crore.
  • Vedanta reported a net profit of ₹4,352 crore for Q2 FY25, compared to a net loss of ₹1,783 crore in the previous year.
  • YTD, Vedanta shares have increased by 78%.
  • The company plans to invest ₹1 lakh crore in Rajasthan, creating one lakh jobs over the next 2-3 years.
“The total interim dividend declared during 2023-24 was ₹29.5 per share.”

In conclusion, Vedanta's decline in stock price reflects market reactions to dividend payouts and broader investment strategies.

title: Bengaluru man spends ₹49,900 on pasta, Swiggy's 2024 data reveals: Key highlights inside - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru Man Spends ₹49,900 on Pasta as Swiggy Reveals 2024 Data

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A Bengaluru man made headlines by spending ₹49,900 on pasta, as highlighted by Swiggy's 2024 data. The data uncovers interesting trends in consumer behavior and food ordering patterns across India.

  • Biryani was the top dish ordered with 83 million total orders.
  • Dosa secured second place with 23 million orders.
  • Fastest delivery was ice cream reaching a customer in Bikaner within 3 minutes.
  • Swiggy's delivery partners covered a monumental 1.96 billion kilometers.
  • Top individual performers included delivery partners completing over 10,000 deliveries.
  • Delhi had the highest orders for Chole Bhature, while Bengaluru excelled in alcohol deliveries.
  • Swiggy Dineout helped diners save ₹533 crore, with Bengaluru diners saving ₹101 crore.
"The highest single bill recorded was an eye-popping ₹3 lakh from a Mumbai diner."

This data not only highlights changing food preferences but also reflects the growing trend of online food delivery in India.
newTitle: Bengaluru Man Spends ₹49,900 on Pasta as Swiggy Reveals 2024 Data

“Amber Enterprises might float an IPO of the electronics division after the demerger is complete.”

This move indicates a strategic shift for Amber Enterprises, potentially unlocking further value in its Electronics division and positioning it for future growth.

title: Greaves Cotton shares rise nearly 4% as unit Greaves Electric Mobility files draft IPO papers with ₹1,000 crore fresh issue - Upstox
Oil prices rise in thin pre-Christmas trade By Reuters - Investing.com
summary:
Oil Prices Rise in Thin Pre-Christmas Trade

Publication Date: December 19, 2023 Source: Reuters

Oil prices rose on Tuesday as market participants reacted to a slightly positive outlook, despite thin trading conditions leading up to the Christmas holiday.

  • Brent crude futures increased by 42 cents (0.6%) to $73.05 per barrel.
  • U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude futures rose by 38 cents (0.6%) to $69.62 per barrel.
  • FGE analysts expect oil prices to fluctuate around current levels through the holiday season.
  • China's plan to issue 3 trillion yuan worth of special treasury bonds is expected to support prices.
  • Mixed economic data from the United States shows new orders for manufactured goods increased, indicating a robust economy.
"Given how short the paper market is on positioning, any supply disruption could lead to upward spikes in structure," analysts noted.

In conclusion, the outlook for the oil market remains cautiously optimistic as trading volume is expected to remain low during the holidays, but upcoming fiscal policies from China and economic indicators from the U.S. contribute to a more stable price environment.
newTitle: Oil Prices Rise Ahead of Christmas

title: Gold and silver price today: Check 22 and 24-carat gold rates in Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata - Upstox
Walmart sued by US watchdog for opening 1 million illegal accounts, making false promises to delivery drivers | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Walmart Faces Lawsuit for Allegedly Opening Illegal Accounts for Delivery Drivers

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Bloomberg

Walmart Inc and Branch Messenger Inc are being sued by the US Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) over allegations of opening unauthorized bank accounts for their delivery drivers as part of the Spark Driver program.

  • The CFPB lawsuit claims that Walmart required drivers to use these accounts to receive payments or face termination.
  • CFPB Director Rohit Chopra stated that Walmart took advantage of over a million delivery drivers.
  • Branch Messenger denies the allegations and claims they will defend their services vigorously.
  • Walmart characterizes the complaint as rushed and full of factual inaccuracies.
  • Drivers reportedly faced issues accessing their earnings, with some never being able to retrieve their money.
  • Immediate fund transfer options had fees, and drivers had limits on transfers.
  • This lawsuit is part of the CFPB’s recent efforts to increase regulatory actions against questionable financial practices.
“Walmart made false promises, illegally opened accounts, and took advantage of more than a million delivery drivers.” - Rohit Chopra, CFPB Director

This legal challenge reflects ongoing scrutiny of financial practices within major corporations and their impact on employees, particularly gig economy workers.
newTitle: Walmart Faces Lawsuit for Allegedly Opening Illegal Accounts for Delivery Drivers

Former CFO of Infosys, Mohandas Pai, has raised concerns about the significant salary disparity in the Indian IT sector, highlighting a meager increase in salaries over the past decade.

  • Salary for IT professionals reportedly rose from Rs 3.2 lakh in 2011 to Rs 3.75 lakh in 2024.
  • This increase reflects broader issues in the tech industry regarding fair compensation.
  • The discussion points to the need for addressing wage stagnation amidst rising living costs.
"The increase in salaries is not reflective of the growing demand for skilled professionals in IT."

This issue has sparked conversations about the necessity of reevaluating compensation practices in the IT sector to ensure they align with current economic realities.
